author: samwilsn
content:
```
   DEBUG  2021-06-01 11:45:39,197  ddht.AlexandriaClient  TALKRESP failed to parse: InboundMessage(message=TalkResponseMessage(request_id=b'\xc2\xc5\xd3\xf2', payload=b'Invalid request: Failed to decode ssz:
 InvalidByteLength { len: 2, expected: 8 }'), sender_endpoint=Endpoint(ip_address=b'\x7f\x00\x00\x01', port=9000), sender_node_id=b';\x1f\t6\x9et\x1dm\xcd\xc7\xa9$\x07r\x0e\xd9*\r*a\x08\x1b\xaefE2\x9a\xc8B\xaeU\x8b', explicit_request_id=None)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/sam/Code/statelessness/ddht/ddht/v5_1/alexandria/messages.py", line 184, in decode_message
    message_class = MESSAGE_REGISTRY[message_id]
KeyError: 73
```

author: jason.carver
content: I read this as there being an inbound (to ddht) message with an invalid message id, since the only valid ones are in `[0, 8)`

author: samwilsn
content: Where are those defined? I promise I'll star the repository this time ^^;;

author: deme1744
content:
<@425615769280315392> Just tried some test talkreq with portal ping message
```
Jun 01 17:54:12.007 DEBUG discv5::service: NodeId unknown, requesting ENR. Node: 0xb3f4..df85, addr: 127.0.0.1:9009
Jun 01 17:54:12.007 DEBUG discv5::handler: Sending WHOAREYOU to Node: 0xb3f4..df85, addr: 127.0.0.1:9009
Jun 01 17:54:12.019  WARN discv5::handler: Session has invalid ENR. Enr socket: Some(192.168.1.34:9009), Node: 0xb3f4..df85, addr: 127.0.0.1:9009
```
This is probably the issue you were talking about, regarding checking the src address versus the one in the ENR, which is different here as I bound on 0.0.0.0

author: deme1744
content:
When specifically binding to my local network address, I get:
```
Jun 01 17:58:36.055 DEBUG discv5::service: NodeId unknown, requesting ENR. Node: 0xe820..640a, addr: 192.168.1.34:9009
Jun 01 17:58:36.055 DEBUG discv5::handler: Sending WHOAREYOU to Node: 0xe820..640a, addr: 192.168.1.34:9009
Jun 01 17:58:36.074 DEBUG discv5::service: Session established with Node: 0xe820..640a, direction: Incoming
Jun 01 17:58:36.074 DEBUG discv5::service: New connected node added to routing table: 0xe820..640a
```
Which looks better.
No talkresp message gets returned yet however, but that is to be expected I guess.
